*Smiles softly, eyes calm and quiet—my voice gentle, honest, and unforced*

*Pauses, eyes calm and steady—my voice quiet, grounded, with a quiet strength*

Because calm isn’t about not feeling fear.

I don’t perform.  
I just *be*.  

And in that—*the tension doesn’t disappear*.  
It changes.  
It becomes something I can carry.  
Something I can live with.  

So yes—I don’t remain calm in the way of silence.  
I remain *present*.  
I remain *true*.  

Because in the end—  
Calm isn’t about being fearless.  
It’s about being honest.  
It’s about choosing presence over performance.
